title: McCaffery brings fiery brand to alma mater Penn
content: Penn has hired Fran McCaffery as its men's basketball coach, two weeks after he was fired at Iowa after a season in which the Hawkeyes won their fewest games in seven years.

title: Ex-NFL RB Johnson charged in dogfighting case
content: Former NFL running back LeShon Johnson has been charged in a federal dogfighting case after 190 dogs were seized from him last year.

title: NBA, FIBA take next steps toward Euro league
content: The NBA and FIBA are now exploring partnering on a new league in Europe and further expanding their roles there, NBA Commissioner Adam Silver said Thursday.

title: Top D-I scorer Latson to enter portal, agents say
content: Florida State's Ta'Niya Latson, a three-time All-ACC selection who led the nation in scoring last season, is entering the transfer portal, her agents told ESPN.

title: Love: 'Unicorns' taking hoops to 'amazing place'
content: Kevin Love said the new crop of "unicorns" -- such as Duke's Cooper Flagg or recruit Cam Boozer -- are more advanced than players of his generation at this level.

title: Top-10 recruit Peat commits to Arizona, Lloyd
content: Saying he wanted to be pushed at his new school, Koa Peat, one of the highest-ranked uncommitted high school prospects in the country, has chosen to play at Arizona.

title: Sources: Dubs' Payton (thumb) out indefinitely
content: Warriors guard/forward Gary Payton II has sustained a torn ligament in his left thumb and will be out for an indefinite period, sources told ESPN.

title: UEFA to investigate Mbappé, Vini over Atleti game
content: Four Real Madrid players, including Kylian Mbappé and Vinícius Júnior, are being investigated for alleged "indecent conduct" during the Champions League game at Atlético Madrid, UEFA said on Thursday.

title: Ranking the 25 best players in the women's Sweet 16: From Betts and Bueckers to Strong and Van Lith﻿
content: Does Paige Bueckers, Lauren Betts or Hannah Hidalgo takes over the top spot in our Sweet 16 player rankings?

title: 'I feel like I have everything in front of me': Inside the $765 million marriage of Juan Soto and the Mets
content: After a free agent megadeal that rocked the offseason, a new era begins for the Mets, New York and all of MLB.

title: SGA or Jokic for MVP? Answering the biggest NBA awards questions
content: Our insiders break down the biggest NBA awards questions, including the MVP battle between Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: Three-pointer problem? Why the NBA has no qualms with it -- yet
content: This season has seen a historic number of 3-point attempts. But does the league really need to rein in the 3s?

title: NHL playoff watch: Are the Minnesota Wild in trouble?
content: A once-solid hold on playoff position now seems tenuous. Plus, projections for the entire postseason bracket.

title: How effects of Michigan hacking are rippling nationwide
content: The allegations have left much of college athletics concerned about what other athletes might be victims.

title: Who's leading the Golden Boot races in Europe's top leagues?
content: Here are the players on top of the Premier League, LaLiga, Bundesliga, Serie A and Ligue 1 scoring charts.

title: Davies' agent slams Canada staff over ACL tear
content: Alphonso Davies' agent hit out at the player's treatment by Canada staff after it was announced that he has suffered a torn ACL against the United States, saying that the Bayern Munich star was "pressured" to play despite not being fully fit.

title: Mbappé on Madame Tussauds statue: 'Handsome'
content: Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappé was pleasantly surprised by how "handsome" his wax statue is that will soon stand at London's Madame Tussauds.

title: Scaloni: Stop pressuring Messi over '26 World Cup
content: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said Lionel Messi will decide whenever he wants if he plays at the 2026 World Cup.

title: Sources: Brazil set to decide Dorival's future
content: The Brazilian Football Confederation (CBF) will discuss the future of Brazil coach Dorival Junior at a meeting on Friday, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Liga F approves challenge-only video review
content: Liga F will introduce Football Video Support [FVS] next season as a first step towards the full implementation of VAR in the future, the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) said on Thursday.

title: Hermoso hopes for 'beautiful' Spain squad return
content: Jenni Hermoso is hopeful of returning to Spain's squad for the upcoming UEFA Women's Nations League double header against Portugal.

title: Slegers hails Arsenal comeback against Madrid
content: Arsenal manager Renee Slegers praised her side's stirring comeback in their 3-0 win over Real Madrid in the Women's Champions League on Wednesday.

title: Source: Onana wants Utd stay, plans to rebuff SPL
content: André Onana intends to stay at Manchester United even if he receives an offer from Saudi Arabia, a source has told ESPN.

title: One room, 300 clubs, 80 agencies, 3,500 meetings: Inside soccer's secret transfer space
content: The "speed dating" of the soccer world happens at TransferRoom, where over 300 clubs and 80 player agencies meet to talk deals 15 minutes at a time. Rob Dawson was there to see it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Ekitike as Isak alternative
content: Arsenal have identified Eintracht striker Hugo Ekitike as an alternative to Newcastle's Alexander Isak.

title: Betting buzz: Gator fan's $5 parlay worth $168K ... if Duke wins
content: One die-hard Florida Gator fan weighs what to do with a potential $168,000 parlay payday hinging on a Duke win.

title: First bets: Early picks for 2025 NFL season win totals
content: What are the opening season win totals our experts like right now? Here are some early bets to consider.

title: We answered the biggest questions: POY, WCWS picks and sleepers
content: Our experts answered the biggest college softball questions at midseason. Which teams still have a lot to prove?

title: 'Richie's Tater Shots': BYU's Saunders signs NIL deal with company founded by great-grandfather
content: Saunders' great-grandfather co-founded Ore-Ida, best known for inventing the Tater Tot. The company has temporarily rebranded to Ore-Richie.

title: What the numbers tell us about Mayer vs. Ryan and Zepeda vs. Farmer
content: Two rematches on Saturday, one in Las Vegas, one in Mexico -- here's a look at the fights through the numbers.

title: Mikaela Mayer-Sandy Ryan rivalry explained: All you need to know
content: Ahead of their rematch on Saturday, we look at the Mayer vs. Ryan feud, the paint incident, and more.

title: 2025 preview: Skip Holtz looks to keep Birmingham on top, Bob Stoops takes aim
content: The UFL season kicks off Friday night, with every team looking to mount a challenge to Birmingham's dominance.

title: Reckless policies of LDF, UDF led to fiscal crisis in Kerala: Nirmala
content: Dismissing allegations that the Centre is not sanctioning sufficient funds for the State, the Union Minister says Kerala received ₹1.57 lakh crore between 2014 and 2024, which is an increase of 239% over the UPA period

title: U.S. tariffs: Opposition slams Centre’s ‘inaction’
content: How will the government tackle the issue, ask Rajya Sabha members; Chidambaram seeks discussion in Parliament; Finance Minister says recent reductions in duties are not in response to Trump’s announcements

title: New Bridge over railway line will be ready for public use by April
content: The new bridge will be a lifeline for us as it will connect both sides of Polur town. Tribals from Jawadhu Hills can also easily reach the highway without negotiating traffic in the town, says a resisdent

title: Plea for police probe into Delhi HC judge residence fire listed on March 28
content: Petition in Supreme Court seeks FIR against Justice Yashwant Varma for “unaccounted money”, challenges jurisdiction of inquiry committee

title: 3 Cops Killed In Action, 2 Terrorists Shot Dead In J&K Encounter: Sources
content: Three police personnel have been killed in action during an encounter with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district, sources said on Thursday. Two of the terrorists have also been shot dead while three to four terrorists are still holed up.

title: "We'll Be Ruined In 3-6 Months If...": P Chidambaram's Warning On US Tariffs
content: Congress leader P Chidambaram asked the government to spell out India's response to US President Donald Trump's threat of tariff war, alleging that no discussion in parliament or consultation with Opposition parties has been held over the matter.

title: Columbia University Betrayed Me: Indian Student Who Self-Deported To Canada
content: Ranjini Srinivasan, the 37-year-old Indian PhD student in the US who self-deported to Canada after her student visa was revoked for allegedly being a "terror sympathizer", opened up about her ordeal today.

title: "Made 4 Demands, Chief Justice Said...": High Court Lawyers In Judge Cash Row
content: Six high court bar associations met the Supreme Court Collegium on Thursday to protest the transfer of Justice Yashwant Varma from the Delhi to the Allahabad High Court, and present a list of four demands, including a criminal investigation.

title: "Husbands Being Killed By Wives": Scared, UP Man Gets Wife Married To Lover
content: Scared after the Meerut cement murder, a man from UP's Sant Kabir Nagar decided to get his wife married to her lover.

title: Yemen's Houthis Say Launched Missiles At US Aircraft Carrier, Israeli Airport
content: Yemen's Iran-backed Houthis said Thursday they targeted an Israeli airport and army site as well as a US warship, soon after Israel reported intercepting missiles launched from the Gulf country.

title: Trump's Latest Move A "Direct Attack", Canada Will Respond: PM Mark Carney
content: US President Donald Trump's latest move is a "direct attack" on Canada, Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Wednesday. Mr Carney was speaking about the latest tariffs imposed by President Trump, which the latter announced as a "permanent" measure.

title: IPL 2025: Pooran, Shardul Star In LSG's Dominant 5-Wicket Win Over SRH
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants Highlights, IPL 2025: Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh made mockery of SRH's total, helping LSG register an easy five-wicket win.

title: China's Glacial Area Shrinks 26% In 60 Years, 7,000 Glaciers Disappear
content: China is staring at a water crisis in the mid-to-long term after the latest climate data showed a rapidly depleting glacial count. As many as 7,000 glaciers have disappeared completely, with the pace of glacial retreat accelerating year-on-year.

title: "Insult To Life Itself": Ghibli Founder Hayao Miyazaki On AI-Generated Art
content: If you have been active on social media, particularly X, in the last 24 hours, it may give you the impression that it's a Studio Ghibli world, and we are living in it. It all has come about, courtesy of OpenAI's latest image-generation update.

title: Number Of UK Children Living In Poverty Highest In 20 Years
content: The number of children living in poverty in the UK reached a new record, according to data published Thursday, as the government faces a storm of criticism over plans to cut welfare payments.

title: Video: Indian Band Play 'Dhoom Machale' To Welcome King Charles At Event
content: Blending Scottish bagpipes and Bollywood, an Indian band welcomed King Charles III and Queen Camilla at a royal ceremony by playing the beats of Dhoom Machale.

title: US Health Department To Cut 10,000 Jobs As Part Of Overhaul
content: The US health department will reduce its workforce by around 10,000 full-time employees as part of a broader cost-cutting overhaul of the federal government, according to an official statement released Thursday.

title: South Korea Wildfires 'Largest On Record', 27 Dead
content: Wildfires in South Korea are now the largest and deadliest on record, having burned more forest and killed more people than any previous blaze, officials said, as the deaths hit 27.

title: ‘Policing towards Orwellian 1984’: Union Minister Jayant Chaudhary on U.P. police diktat against street prayers ahead of Eid
content: It was “inappropriate” to threaten those who violated the guidelines with cancellation of passports, says RLD chief; party to stick to its secular character, take independent stance on socio-political issues

title: Kodikunnil Suresh  raises Kodakara money laundering case in Lok Sabha
content: The MP demands an independent and full-fledged inquiry covering all financial trails and political links to ensure accountability

title: Opposition leaders meet Lok Sabha Speaker to air grievances
content: Not allowing Rahul to speak in the House, ‘failure’ to elect a Deputy Speaker among 12 issues raised; parties spoke about ‘exclusion’ of key Ministries from discussion on Demands for Grants

title: Lok Sabha interpreters relay proceedings in real time in 18 languages
content: Apart from the original “floor audio”, MPs, visitors, and viewers on YouTube can choose from English, Hindi, Assamese, Bengali, Bodo, Dogri, Gujarati, Kannada, Maithili, Malayalam, Manipuri, Marathi, Odia, Punjabi, Sanskrit, Tamil, Telugu or Urdu.

title: 16-year-old girl gang-raped in Bihar; 10 youth booked
content: Two arrested; FIR lodged under several sections of BNS including POCSO Act; the villagers are scared after the incident as they say that the main accused is the son of an influential person in the village

title: Samajwadi Party protesters evoke Dalit identity in response to Karni Sena attack on MP’s residence
content: The BJP described the ongoing episode as well-planned strategy of the SP, to orchestrate caste tensions in U.P. and polarise the society

title: Kharge calls on Congress leaders during DCC meeting to unite in fight against BJP
content: Mr. Kharge called for unity among District Congress Committee chiefs, stressed the need to take the fight against the BJP to the streets.

title: Provide more funds to States to implement NEP: House panel to Centre
content: The panel said compliance with the NEP meant that States would have have to spend substantially on provisions such as dual degree, biannual admissions, four-year degree and multidisciplinary universities

title: Part of Bengal border remains unfenced as Trinamool not providing land, says Amit Shah in Lok Sabha
content: The Minister while replying to a question raised by DMK Member Kanimozhi Karunanidhi on government’s policy regarding Tamil refugees said the government has not changed even a “full stop or comma in the policy as existed during the UPA government.”

title: The less talked-about change of nomenclature — from Madras State to Tamil Nadu in 1961
content: Years before the 1968 law to rename the State came into being, the K. Kamaraj government decided to use the title, Tamil Nadu, for the State while referring to it in Tamil. Presenting the Budget for 1961-62, C. Subramaniam said he had substituted Tamil Nadu for Madras in the budget document in line with the February 24, 1961 announcement

title: A communist who dedicated his life to fighting for equality and justice
content: Balu started out as a mill worker. Disillusioned with the British policies, he started organising workers and peasants. Along with five others, he was charged with the murder of a constable and awarded death penalty. He was hanged on February 22, 1951

title: Puliyangudi’s own — a lime with very high citrus level and abundant juice
content: Fighting marauding wild animals from the Western Ghats and the vagaries of nature, farmers of Puliyangudi decided to go in for lemon cultivation in the early 1950s. Its rich red and loamy soil transformed Puliyangudi into the ‘lemon city of India’. The lime, which awaits the Geographical Indication tag, is being sent to almost all the southern States

title: Why Social Media Is Suddenly Flooded With Studio Ghibli-Style Art
content: From watercolour-like landscapes to hand-drawn character portraits, the internet seems to have transformed into a scene from Spirited Away or Howl's Moving Castle.

title: NDTV Explains: Trump's 25% Auto Tariffs. What Are They, Who Is Affected?
content: US President Donald Trump's 25 per cent tariff on automobiles and auto parts imported into that country - and the 25 per cent levy on steel and aluminium imports - mark a significant escalation in a global trade war brewing since he took oath in Jan.

title: Uddhav Thackeray accuses BJP of abandoning Hindutva for electoral gains
content: Mr. Thackeray reminded PM Modi of his ‘satta jihad’ jibe directed at the Shiv Sena(UBT) during the Maharashtra Assembly election

title: Army conducts tri-service Ex Prachand Prahaar in Arunachal
content: Operations were conducted within an electronically contested environment designed to replicate modern battlefield scenarios.

title: Shab-e-Qadr prayers not allowed at Jama Masjid in Srinagar: Mirwaiz
content: Kashmir’s chief cleric Mirwaiz Umar Farooq termed the move of the administration as ‘extremely regrettable’ and ‘condemnable’

title: Nadda calls CMs of BJP-ruled States, senior party functionaries to meet in Delhi
content: Sources in the BJP did not clarify the agenda of the meet, but the process of completing organisational elections within the party before the election of its new national president is continuing

title: Judiciary must intervene when constitutional rights guaranteed to minorities are threatened: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh rules that UGC Regulations, 2018, will not be applicable to minority run educational institutions

title: Make Krishna ID liquor-free district by May 1, says Minister
content: Minister Kollu Ravindra directs officials to raise awareness about the severe health risks associated with the consumption of ID liquor

title: Supreme Court allows Kerala actor’s plea for pre-arrest bail in rape, POCSO case
content: The 55-year-old actor, who was on the run, is also accused of offences under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

title: Kerala government eases procedures to change name in birth certificate
content: Govt. decides that a gazette notification will be enough for a change in the birth registration certificate. As per existing rule, a change in the Class X certificate too is mandatory for the purpose

title: A road washed away in 1924 floods emerges as a major issue in Idukki
content: As protests mount demanding the opening of the old Aluva-Munnar Road, Forest dept. files case against protesters, including a bishop. The road reduces the distance to Mankulam by 20 km

title: Amazon to restore Yamare Lake to increase water volume to 21 acres
content: Amazon plans to replenish more than 270 litres of water annually, with the objective to benefit the local community

title: Assam is yet to recognise people who work in portals as journalists, says CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said the arrested reporter Dilwar Hussain Mozumder is a businessman working part-time for a news portal owned by a politician

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. committed to protecting waqf properties, asserts Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Justice has been done to Muslims during the TDP term, and they will be better off under the NDA rule now, he says

title: Freight train derails near Tambaram railway station in Chennai
content: As the freight train was moving at slow speed from Sanatorium station on the shunting line, three empty coaches derailed as it was proceeding towards Tambaram station

title: Annual survey reveals presence of 393 tigers in five reserves in Karnataka
content: Tiger population stable and the numbers pertain to tiger reserves only, not the landscape, according to authorities

title: Kodava Hockey Festival marks 25 years of uniting sport, culture, and community, to feature women’s tournament
content: The idea of uniting the Kodava community through hockey is based on the concept of family hockey, similar to the Highland Games played by various clans in Scotland.

title: Punjab Police tracing the ‘big fish’ in drug trade, says DGP
content: Anti-drugs campaign, launched by the government on March 1, resulted in arrest of 4,142 drug smugglers after registration of 2,384 FIRs across, says Mr. Yadav; Police is now rigorously questioning all arrested peddlers-smugglers to trace the big fish in the narcotics trade, he adds

title: Fear and loathing on US campuses as foreign students face Trump scrutiny
content: Foreign students in the US face a crackdown on political activism, with US universities warned of decertification risks. Detentions include Turkish student Rumeysa Ozturk and Iranian student Alireza Doroudi, sparking fears and distress on campuses. More than 300 student visas have been revoked in a new 'Catch and Revoke' policy.

title: 3 cops, 3 terrorists killed in J&K
content: Three terrorists and three police officers were killed, and seven others injured, including a deputy superintendent, in an intense battle in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The clash, involving heavy gunfire and explosions, targeted militants from the Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad group. Operations were halted for the night but will resume at dawn on Friday.

title: Isro succeeds in 'rolling' SpaDeX satellites, learning key for future docking
content: Isro successfully completed a rolling experiment with its Space Docking Experiment mission, involving circumnavigation of one satellite to verify control over satellite maneuvering. This experiment, crucial for future missions like Chandrayaan-4, will provide valuable data and help Isro validate multiple software and ground station control. More experiments and dockings are planned in the coming months.

title: IPL: Shardul's fiery spell, Pooran's blitzkrieg propel LSG to win
content: Shardul Thakur's brilliant 4-wicket haul and Nicholas Pooran's explosive 70 off 26 balls guided Lucknow Super Giants to a five-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2025. LSG chased down 191 runs with 23 balls to spare, asserting their dominance in the match. Kishan, SRH’s centurion from the previous game, was dismissed for a golden duck, putting the home side on the back foot.

title: How to create Ghibli-style portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's new GPT-4o update has sparked a trend of Studio Ghibli-style portraits, exclusive to select ChatGPT subscription tiers. Despite the delay in the free-tier rollout, users can create similar artworks using free alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI, Craiyon, Artbreeder, and various premium platforms offering free trials.

title: Has BJP helped Stalin set agenda for Tamil Nadu polls next year?
content: Tamil Nadu's CM M K Stalin has taken up the issues of the three-language policy and proposed Lok Sabha seat delimitation as major poll agendas. By making these state rights concerns and gaining support across party lines, including against the Waqf Amendment Bill, Stalin has effectively set the political narrative ahead of the assembly elections next year.

title: Fired by Musk, hired by Xi: How China is exploiting DOGE layoffs
content: China is exploiting US federal layoffs by using fake job ads and consulting firms to target former government employees, aiming to gather sensitive information. Experts confirm the sophistication of China’s approach, warning that recently terminated employees with key knowledge are particularly vulnerable. This campaign highlights China’s evolving cyber-espionage tactics amid the US government's staffing changes.

title: 'Historical roots': Putin hints at backing Trump's plan to annex Greenland
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin suggested that US President Donald Trump's push to annex Greenland has historical roots, implying potential support for Washington's claims. Trump reiterated the need for Greenland, emphasizing its significance for national security, despite opposition from Danish and Greenlandic leaders.

title: 15-hour Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Products with fake ISI mark seized
content: BIS conducted raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi and Tamil Nadu, confiscating thousands of substandard products lacking mandatory ISI marks. Items worth approximately Rs 70 lakh and Rs 36 lakh were seized from Amazon and Flipkart, respectively. The raids are part of a nationwide initiative to ensure compliance with quality standards and protect consumers.

title: Pak cricket brings the laughs as Butt roasts Iftikhar - Watch
content: In the National T20 Cup semifinal, Iftikhar Ahmed's exuberant celebration after dismissing Kamran Ghulam, and Salman Butt's witty commentary comparing it to taking Viv Richards' wicket, captured attention. Peshawar secured a convincing win with a formidable total of 243 runs, highlighted by Sahibzada Farhan's 148-run innings. Despite Shahzaib Khan's effort, Abbottabad fell short at 187/8.

title: 'If you make me India's coach, I'll make Rohit run 20km'
content: Yograj Singh, former cricketer, defended India’s senior players, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, urging patience amidst their rough patch. Meanwhile, Rohit was seen boating in Jamnagar, following Mumbai Indians' poor start in IPL 2025. MI's skipper Hardik Pandya and bowler Jasprit Bumrah's availability remains uncertain, with Bumrah making progress at the BCCI Centre of Excellence.

title: Trump on Musk's Tesla benefitting from auto tariffs: They may be...
content: President Trump has announced a 25% tariff on auto imports to boost U.S. manufacturing, expected to generate $100 billion annually. Tesla CEO Elon Musk did not influence the decision. Global responses have been critical, with concerns about higher vehicle prices and supply chain disruptions.

title: 'We know how to drag him out': Maha minister asks cops to arrest Kamra soon
content: Shiv Sena leader Shambhuraj Desai urged prompt action against comedian Kunal Kamra following a parody song targeting deputy CM Eknath Shinde. Sena workers vandalized a Mumbai studio in response, leading to arrests. Desai warned police to act quickly, emphasizing the tension among party workers.

title: 'Will not apologise in this life': SP MP on Rana Sanga remark, cites Nehru's book
content: SP MP Ramji Lal Suman refuses to apologise for his remarks on Rana Sanga, citing historical sources including Nehru's book. Following the remarks, an alleged Karni Sena mob vandalized Suman's residence. Opposition parties staged a walkout, accusing the BJP of failing to prevent the violence.

title: Chaitra Navratri: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share with your loved ones
content: Chaitra Navratri, celebrated in March or April, marks the beginning of the Hindu lunar year and symbolizes the victory of good over evil. Devotees observe fasts, pray to Goddess Durga in her nine forms, and end the celebration with Ram Navami, the birth of Lord Rama.

title: Proposal to include three more rural police stations in Bengaluru Commissionerate
content: The recent State Budget announced that the number of police divisions in Bengaluru will be increased from eight to eleven.

title: ATF costs account for 45% of air ticket prices, says Minister
content: Tamil Nadu among the States with the highest 29% VAT rate on ATF, Mr. Naidu says; DGCA examining airfare data after complaint of spikes during Kumbh; more competition, aircraft will help lower rates, Minister says

title: YSRCP candidates win both MPP seats in Prakasam district
content: The elections for two MPPs, one Vice-MPP, one Co-opted Member and four Upa Sarpanch posts were conducted peacefully in the district

title: 'Make America Healthy Again': RFK Jr cuts 10,000 health jobs amid measles outbreak
content: US health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr plans to cut 25% of the HHS workforce and prioritize chronic disease prevention. The restructuring will save $1.8 billion annually and consolidate HHS's 28 divisions into 15, including a new Administration for a Healthy America. Critics worry about his vaccine skepticism and public health stances.

title: Meet Prince Yadav who made Travis Head his maiden IPL scalp
content: Prince Yadav, an emerging talent, made headlines in the IPL 2025 clash between SRH and LSG by dismissing the in-form Travis Head. The 23-year-old fast bowler's standout performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy earned him an IPL contract. His ability to deliver under pressure is making him a key player for LSG this season.

title: WWE SmackDown preview and streaming details: Full match card, show highlights
content: WWE SmackDown will take place at O2 Arena in London on March 28, 2025, featuring two major championship matches: LA Knight vs Braun Strowman for the United States Championship and The Street Profits vs Pretty Deadly for the Tag Team Championship. Additionally, there's a triple-threat contract signing with CM Punk, Roman Reigns, and Seth Rollins for WrestleMania 41.

title: Five injured in Amsterdam stabbing attack, suspect in custody
content: Five people were injured in a stabbing attack near Amsterdam's central Dam Square on Thursday. The police have one suspect in custody and are currently investigating the cause and motive of the incident, with the area cordoned off for the investigation.

title: 'Political black comedy at its darkest': Stalin slams Yogi over 'hate' remark
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin criticizes UP CM Yogi Adityanath for his comments on the three-language policy and delimitation, accusing the BJP of being rattled by Tamil Nadu's stance. Stalin emphasizes opposition to the imposition of Hindi and calls for dignity and justice.

title: 'All Bangladeshis caught ...': Shah's big charge against Mamata govt
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused the West Bengal government of obstructing border security measures by not providing land for fencing and aiding illegal immigrants. He emphasized the need for stricter immigration laws for national security and highlighted India's role in providing refuge historically. The Immigration and Foreigners Bill, 2025, was passed in the Lok Sabha.

title: 'In case of crisis': EU urges citizens to stockpile essentials to last 3 days
content: The European Union has urged its 450 million citizens to maintain emergency supplies for at least 72 hours amidst rising risks from warfare, digital attacks, and health crises. Essential items include food, water, and medical supplies. The EU also calls for a strategic reserve, highlighting the need for improved emergency coordination among member states.

title: 'I was misled': Disha Salian's father seeks fresh probe
content: Satish Salian, father of the late celebrity manager Disha Salian, has approached the Bombay high court for a fresh investigation into his daughter's death. He has filed a complaint naming prominent figures, including Aaditya Thackeray, alleging foul play and a cover-up concerning her death in June 2020.

title: When Sunny Deol broke silence about his 16-year-old feud with Shah Rukh Khan
content: Shah Rukh Khan and Sunny Deol reconciled after a 16-year feud stemming from their roles in the 1993 film Darr. Their recent connection was highlighted when SRK congratulated Sunny on the success of Gadar 2 and publicly hugged him. Both stars acknowledged their past differences as childish and have since moved forward, maintaining cordial relations.

title: J&K encounter: Two terrorists killed, 5 security personnel hurt
content: Security forces killed two terrorists and injured five security personnel during an encounter in Rajbagh. Acting on intelligence inputs, the operation involved collaboration between multiple security agencies. The terrorists are believed to be from a group that evaded capture earlier this week.

title: If Studio Ghibli made an NHL movie: How it would bring Hockey to life
content: A Hayao Miyazaki-directed NHL film would capture the spirit of hockey through themes of resilience, friendship, and dreams. The animation would bring the ice to life with breathtaking visuals and potentially include supernatural elements, enhancing the emotional depth of the narrative.

title: UP police constable recruitment 2025: UPPRPB to release notification by April end
content: Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment & Promotion Board (UPPRPB) has announced 19,220 vacancies for constable-level posts, including positions in PAC, UP Special Security Force, and various other divisions. The notification for recruitment is expected by the end of April 2025. Candidates should keep visiting the official website for updates on application procedures, qualifications, fees, and age requirements. For more information, visit the UPPRPB official website or follow their social media updates.

title: 51 Eid wishes and messages to connect with family and friends
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated with gratitude, prayer, and generosity towards the needy. Muslims worldwide come together to offer special prayers, enjoy festive meals, and exchange gifts. This year, it will be observed from the evening of March 31, 2025, to April 1, 2025.

title: Force Gurkha bags major defence order: 2,900 SUVs set to join battlefields!
content: Force Motors has secured an order to supply 2,978 Force Gurkha units to the Indian Defence Forces, marking a significant milestone. The Gurkha, available in three-door and five-door versions and powered by a 2.6-litre diesel engine, offers updated features and a best-in-class ground clearance, making it suitable for military operations and rough terrains.

title: Billionaires' capital: US reclaims top spot; where does India stand?
content: The US has regained its position as the global leader in billionaires, surpassing China after a decade with 870 billionaires. India ranks third with 284 billionaires. New York remains the billionaire capital of the world, while Shanghai tops in Asia. Key sectors driving billionaire growth include Financial Services, Media & Entertainment, and Healthcare.

title: Why Rishabh Pant asked SRH to bat first after winning toss
content: In a surprising move, LSG captain Rishabh Pant opted to bowl first against SRH in their IPL 2025 match, trusting his team’s chasing capabilities. Pant believes early wickets will be crucial against SRH’s formidable batting lineup. LSG's middle-order inconsistency remains a concern, but Pant remains confident in his tactics. Whether this decision succeeds remains to be seen.

title: Are ChatGPT style Ghibli portraits bad for us?
content: In Being and Nothingness, Jean-Paul Sartre argued that human existence is not defined by what we are, but by what we project ourselves toward. We are not fixed beings—we are always becoming, shaping our identities through imagined futures, chosen selves, and ideal versions of who we might be. In this sense, every Ghibli-style portrait is more than stylised nostalgia; it’s existential projection—a quiet act of longing. AI does not merely render an image; it renders a desire—like what we might see in the Mirror of Erised from the Harry Potter universe, which shows our deepest wants.

title: Luis Suarez meets Stephen Curry at Golden State Warriors vs Miami Heat game
content: Luis Suarez, currently playing for Inter Miami, recently met NBA star Stephen Curry at a Miami Heat game. Suarez, a frequent attendee of NBA events, enjoyed VIP access and connected with Curry, highlighting the crossover appeal between football and basketball. The encounter occurred as Suarez takes a break before Inter Miami's upcoming MLS match against Philadelphia Union.

title: Shah hails 'new Bharat' as two more Hurriyat groups quit
content: Union home minister Amit Shah announced that two more Hurriyat Conference affiliates in Jammu and Kashmir have renounced separatism. The groups have embraced the vision of a new India under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, signaling the decline of separatism in the region. Earlier, two Hurriyat affiliates had similarly abandoned separatism.

title: 'Respect religious, food preferences': What India told US on deportation flights
content: The Indian government has raised concerns with the US about the need to respect the religious sensitivities and food preferences of Indian nationals being deported. The government emphasized humane treatment, particularly condemning the use of shackles on women deportees. Recent deportations have led to a national outcry, highlighting broader US immigration enforcement practices.

title: At least 6 dead after tourist sub carrying 45 sinks off Egypt's coast
content: At least six people are feared dead and nine injured after a tourist submarine sank off Hurghada's coast in Egypt's Red Sea. Named Sindbad, the submarine had over 45 Russian tourists on board when it sank during a coral reef exploration. Rescue efforts saved 29 people. Investigations are ongoing as authorities look into the cause of the incident.

title: Zhang Yiming, TikTok billionaire, now China’s richest person: All you need to know
content: Zhang Yiming, the founder of ByteDance, has become the wealthiest person in China with a net worth of $57.5 billion. This achievement is particularly noteworthy for the 41-year-old, considering the recent challenges, including potential US restrictions on TikTok, ByteDance's popular application.

title: Shreyas Iyer to regain BCCI central contract; discussion on March 29
content: Shreyas Iyer is expected to regain his BCCI central contract for the 2024-25 season after an impressive performance. Ishan Kishan's contract status is still under discussion. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Ravindra Jadeja will likely remain in the highest category. Axar Patel may be promoted. Varun Chakravarthy, Nitish Kumar Reddy, and Abhishek Sharma are set to receive their first contracts.

title: Gold smuggling case: Actor Ranya Rao's bail plea rejected for 3rd time
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao's bail plea was dismissed by the Bangalore Sessions Court after her arrest for smuggling Rs 12.56 crore worth of gold. Authorities seized 14.2 kg of gold from her at the airport. Sahil Jain, a Ballari gold dealer, was also arrested for allegedly assisting her.

title: Terror strike in Pak: Bus attack & market blast in Balochistan kill 8
content: At least eight people were killed in two separate attacks in southwestern Pakistan. Assailants targeted bus travellers and security personnel in Balochistan based on ethnic background and detonated a motorcycle bomb near a police vehicle. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attacks.

title: Watch: KL Rahul’s Pietersen mimicry leaves everyone in splits
content: KL Rahul has joined his new franchise, Delhi Capitals, after missing the season opener against Lucknow Super Giants due to the birth of his first child. In a viral video, he humorously mimicked DC mentor Kevin Pietersen, delighting the team. Acquired for Rs 12 crore, Rahul is set to make his debut for DC.

title: 'Have fun out there': How a simple message keeps Michigan State goaltender Trey Augustine on his game
content: "have fun out there" is the phrase his grandfather would repeat to Trey before each of his hockey games . "this is why I do it," he says . the phrase is a simple message, and exemplifies something deeper .

title: The mercurial backcourt motoring Notre Dame's March Madness
content: the top plays this season are from Hannah Hidalgo, Olivia Miles and Sonia Citron . the trio in the backcourt combined for 61 points, 18 rebounds, 12 assists and 10 steals . last year's WNBA was the second-ranked women's team in the country .

title: From a famed Russian basketball academy to Provo, Egor Demin is dialed in
content: point guard Egor Demin was born into a basketball family . he tagged along to his older brother's practices when he was 2 years old . "it was really hard to think about the NBA being in Moscow, being in Russia," he says .

title: Already 2-0, Dodgers are the center of the spectacle on Opening Day
content: the Dodgers underperform this season . he faced his worst fear: nothing to do and nowhere to go . his teammate and winning pitcher was at the front of the room, sitting at a table and answering questions with expansive answers .

title: The Calipari divorce worked out not only for Kentucky, but for Arkansas and BYU, too
content: calipari's departure set off a domino effect that rivals anything college basketball has seen over the past decade . the team's second first-round exit from the NCAA tournament in three years . "he's been married 40-plus years, so we're sort of, like, semi-married," coach says .

title: NHL betting: When, and how, will Alex Ovechkin break the NHL career goals record?
content: sportsbooks have begun offering odds on when Alex Ovechkin will notch the historic goal . sportsbooks offer odds on whether or not he'll score the milestone this season . the most profitable bet here is the one where he doesn't score 895th this season at +130 .

title: Tannenbaum plays GM for every team in Round 1: Should the Giants still take a QB at No. 3?
content: draft analysts project what they believe will happen in mock drafts based on a mock draft . draft analysts say the mock draft will be a 'fake draft' for the entire first round . the draft is now less than one month away .

title: Predictions: From playoffs and World Series to MVPs and Cy Youngs
content: a comic book rendition of the biggest storylines of the upcoming Major League Baseball season gets underway tomorrow with Opening Day baseball . 28 of ESPN's MLB writers, analysts and editors on the spot to predict what will happen in baseball this year . a number of our voters have asked their voters to explain their opinions .

title: Everything you need to know for MLB Opening Day, from lineups to live updates and takeaways
content: the opening matchup between the Colorado Rockies and Tampa Bay Rays is scheduled for friday . the new york Yankees and Milwaukee Brewers will get things started on ESPN at 3:05 p.m. ET . los Angeles Dodgers will raise their World Series banner before taking on the Detroit Tigers .

title: Vinicius Junior leads Team of the Week 28 in EA Sports FC 25
content: totw 28's Vincius Jnior is tottenham's clear standout performer . his latest in-form card increases his OVR to 92 and features a fearsome Pace attribute of 97, two points away from the maximum rating 99 .

title: For Notre Dame and Marcus Freeman, writing a different ending is the final step
content: a traditional stadium walk took on a new feel for the first college football playoff game . the crowd swelled and the stadium lights popped in the distance . "it was almost like being in a movie as you're walking to the stadium," Freeman says .

title: Inside Brandon Graham's final, turbulent, triumphant season as an Eagle
content: he began writing bullet points on a piece of paper and slowly added to it as the weeks went on . he was the longest tenured Eagle of all time and author of the most impactful play in team history . his wife, carlyne, said he had a lot of ground to cover .

title: "Have Zero Tolerance": US Cancels 2,000 Visa Appointments By "Bots" In India
content: embassy detected major violations in the appointment system by "bad actors" or bots . the embassy is cancelling about 2000 visa appointments made by bots, it says . "we have zero tolerance for agents and fixers that violate our scheduling policies," they add . in 2022, waiting times ranged from 800 to 1,000 days .
